content.section_header: Select the SYNONYM for each bold word

content.question: After debating for an hour, Marla conceded John’s point that education was a benefit.
Jim is dogmatic about the benefits of a low-protein diet.
The witness was asked to aver that she had seen a third person at the holdup.
The menu at the vegetarian restaurant embodies the chef’s beliefs about good nutrition.
Callie refused to be a part of the propagation of rumors.

content.section_header: Select the ANTONYM for each bold word

content.question: “Stretch” was an apropos nickname for the lanky runner.
The demise of the newsreel coincided with the ascendancy of network television news.
Mom imparted basic cooking abilities to all her children.
Concerned parents organized a book drive to address the deficiency of books in the library.
Students were asked to prepare rudimentary outlines of their projects the next day.

content.section_header: Choose the best way to complete each sentence or answer each question

content.question: Which professional has the least need for oratory?
Which of the following is furthest from the definition of assess?
Which business does not rely upon making something propagate?
A person who is deficient in something has
To sojourn refers to

content.section_header: Read the passage and answer the questions

passage: The most amazing thing happened the other day in debate club. We were having a practice debate about the school uniform when things got a little heated. DeShawn yelled, “UNIFORMS SHOULD BE ILLEGAL!” three times, while the girl he was debating replied, “In my assessment, your oratorical skills are lacking.” You're not arguing effectively. You’re just vociferous. Shouting the same thing over and over again is not going to convince anyone of anything.”
First, DeShawn looked angry, then he looked embarrassed and, finally, he looked defeated. He slumped back in his chair and nodded slowly.

“I have to concede that you are right,” he said as t he whole room watched in silence. Then he stood up ceremoniously, cleared his throat and announced, “So, this is the end of my sojourn as a member of this debate club. I Quit!” Then he walked out. We were all stunned. No one knew what to do. Then my friend tapped the new girl on the shouulder and asked her if she wanted to be the president of the debate club.

content.question: The meaning of assessment (line 7) is
In line 7, oratorical means
The word vociferous (line 9) most nearly means
In line 14, concede means
The meaning of sojourn (line 17) is
